Uses of SQLError in com.jdbwc.exceptions
 

Subclasses of SQLError in com.jdbwc.exceptions
 class MySQLError
          Note from the author: SQLError is a utility class that maps MySQL error codes to X/Open error codes as is required by the JDBC spec.

Note from Tim: Added Type safety elements on map objects and implentations.
Unused portions have been removed and exception class names have been editted to support the JDBWC Driver.
You should have received a copy of the original file with this Drivers source bundle.

PS: Many thanks to the mySql team for making the Connector-J sources available to developers.
Many more thanks to Mark Matthews for writting this class file.
 class PgSQLError
          Note from the author: SQLError is a utility class that maps MySQL error codes to X/Open error codes as is required by the JDBC spec.

Note from Tim: Modified for PostgreSQL and added Type safety elements on map objects and implentations.
Unused portions have been removed and exception class names have been editted to support the JDBWC Driver.
You should have received a copy of the original file with this Drivers source bundle.

PS: Many thanks to the mySql team for making the Connector-J sources available to developers.
Many more thanks to Mark Matthews for writting this class file.
 

Uses of SQLError in com.jdbwc.util
 

Methods in com.jdbwc.util with parameters of type SQLError
static boolean Util.checkForExceptions(SQLError sqle, java.lang.String response)
          Look for SQL errors from the server and script errors from the scripting engine.
Chuck a wobbly (alias: a thrown exception) back to the requesting method with a few details about the problem.
static java.lang.String Util.parseResponse(SQLError sqle, java.io.InputStream ins)
